column1: JINYA Ramen Bar - Houston////Ever since we had ramen at Momofuku in New York
column2: we have been searching for good ramen in Houston.  Jinya not only serves an excellent bowl of ramen
column3: but they have an excellent fried chicken. The chicken is juicy
column4: has a wonderful soy based marinate and crunchy exterior. Splash some fresh lemon
column5: and you need nothing else. Whichever ramen you choose
column6: the broth is amazing. I ordered the pork and my wife ordered the chicken. Both are equally deep and complex in their flavor and very satisfying.  We had Mochi for Dessert. Nothing fancy
column7: but a nice way to end our meal. In total
column10: and dessert. Total price 48.00 with tip. A very nice meal at an affordable price.
